column2: Family Learning 2006-07 - Keeping up with the children

column1: Keeping up with the Children
Learning opportunities for parents, carers and grandparents
• Gain understanding of the National Curriculum
• Feel more confident with parenting issues, including sex education

We are a well -trained team of adult tutors who are very experienced in working with adults. We are part of Tameside Council Adult Learning and as such, we form part of an adult service offering learning opportunities to adults in Tameside.

A very important part of our work is the work we undertake with parents, carers and grandparents within settings such as nurseries, SureStarts, primary and secondary schools. We are happy to work with parents of children from 0 -16!

We believe that parents, carers and grandparents have a vital role in helping children to develop appropriately and to support them in learning, from the early years into teenage years. The range of courses offered in this leaflet have been specifically designed to offer opportunities for groups of parents, carers and grandparents to meet and discuss common issues and concerns.

Many schools and early years settings already work in partnership with us. If you receive information about any sessions being held in your school or nursery, we can guarantee you an interesting, informative time!
If your school or nursery don't already offer family learning opportunities, now is the time to ask them to contact us!

You can contact Gillian Rees Student Services on 0161 331 9586 or 07974 111 676 in relation to any of the courses listed in this leaflet, or to find your nearest venue. Gillian can also offer information on courses in Tameside, career advice and help with job application forms and C.V.'s. She can also discuss issues affecting learning, such as dyslexia.

There are several new courses explained in this leaflet . These can be offered to groups of parents, carers and grandparents at your child's school or nursery - if the nursery or school currently uses our provision.

There are often common issues and concerns that parents, carers and grandparents share about their children, or the children in their care. We decided that that would be our starting point. We wanted to make the courses interesting to make parents want to attend, but we felt that we had to deal with issues that were considered to be really important to families. We are also aware that families come in many shapes and sizes and that any courses we offered could not be a 'one size fit's all'.

We developed the courses, listed here, with you in mind - the busy parent balancing work, family and other commitments. We understand that your time is precious, but we firmly believe that the time you spend on one of our courses will repay the time spent in the benefits gained for your family!
Our courses are free! Can you afford not to join us?
Are you ready to 'Move On'?
'Move On' is aimed at people who don't have GCSE English or Maths and who want to have an adult-friendly equivalent qualification to enhance C.V.'s and future job opportunities.
• Build confidence and self-esteem and gain a qualification
• Brush up skills such as spelling, punctuation and grammar
• Refresh number skills so that you can help with homework
• The test is multiple choice (40 questions)
• The test lasts for 1 hour (literacy) and 1 hour 15 mins (numeracy)
• You can take practice tests as you learn
• You can take the test on-line or paper-based
• Do you dread the day when your child asks where babies come from?
• Do you need to give your child, or teenager , advice and information on sex and relationships?
• Are you anxious about the sex education that your child is offered in school?
Share It! - for parents, carers, grandparents of children and young people of all ages
Parents can negotiate own topics, including:
Men-power! - offered in partnership with Curzon Ashton Football Club and Greggs Bakers
Programme aimed at dads, granddads and male carers
• Changing role of dads in modern families
Baby Days - for parents, carers and grandparents of babies and toddlers
Aimed at parents of Foundation stage children
• Starting to read
Aimed at parents of Key Stage 1 and 2 children
Aimed at parents of Key Stage 3 and 4 (secondary)
Sound as a pound!
Aimed at parents of Foundation and primary school
• Help your children learn about healthy eating and the importance of having 5 a day!
• Helps children understand about plant growth
• Helps parents living on a budget
We offer all our family and adult learning courses to learners who have English as a second language (ESOL)
We offer a full range of adult friendly qualifications at all levels and awarded by recognised bodies such as City & Guilds and OCR (Oxford, Cambridge and RSA examinations)
